label: 没官
対訳語: Division in charge of Stock Farming
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: These were located in various parts of the country, being in charge of the stock farms and pasture lands in the several provinces (kuni) where horses and cattle were bred. The animals were used for transporting taxes, as oxen for the carriages of great dignitaries, as post horses (ekiba), and particularly as cavalry horses for the army. [国、駅馬]
